question.title: Response 403 when converting curl command to Java

node.contents: I am facing a problem with converting a curl command to Java. Below is my curl

astNode.text: I am facing a problem with converting a curl command to Java. Below is my curl

node.contents: and I have tried the Java equivalent this way

astNode.text: and I have tried the Java equivalent this way

elements.contents: String stringUrl = "https://api.XXXX.com/authorizations"; URL url = new URL(stringUrl); URLConnection uc = url.openConnection(); String userpass = "john" + ":" + "doe"; //String basicAuth = "Basic " + new String(new Base64().encode(userpass.getBytes())); String basicAuth = "Basic " + javax.xml.bind.DatatypeConverter.printBase64Binary(userpass.getBytes("UTF-8")); uc.setRequestProperty("Authorization", basicAuth); uc.setRequestProperty("Accept", "application/vnd.drivr.v2+json"); uc.setRequestProperty("Content-type", "application/json"); System.out.println("url is: "+uc.getURL().toString()+" "+basicAuth); InputStream inputStreamReader = uc.getInputStream();

comments.text: //String basicAuth = "Basic " + new String(new Base64().encode(userpass.getBytes())); String basicAuth = "Basic " + javax.xml.bind.DatatypeConverter.printBase64Binary(userpass.getBytes("UTF-8")); uc.setRequestProperty("Authorization", basicAuth); uc.setRequestProperty("Accept", "application/vnd.drivr.v2+json"); uc.setRequestProperty("Content-type", "application/json"); System.out.println("url is: "+uc.getURL().toString()+" "+basicAuth); InputStream inputStreamReader = uc.getInputStream();

node.contents: Its been almost 2 days straight with this. It always gives me 403 response. I am not sure where am I going wrong. Any help would be appreciated. Thanks.

astNode.text: Its been almost 2 days straight with this. It always gives me 403 response. I am not sure where am I going wrong. Any help would be appreciated. Thanks.

node.contents: Your commented line looks a lot better than that XML bind thing.

astNode.text: Your commented line looks a lot better than that XML bind thing.

node.contents: Also in the future, run your curl command with "-v" to see the request headers it is making. Then you can check the Authorization header in there and compare it to the one you're generating in your Java code.

astNode.text: Also in the future, run your curl command with "-v" to see the request headers it is making. Then you can check the Authorization header in there and compare it to the one you're generating in your Java code.

node.contents: I can see your curl command has -d '' parameter. It means http POST request.

astNode.text: I can see your curl command has -d '' parameter. It means http POST request.

node.contents: But your java code is doing GET request to the server. So change your java code so that it does the POST request. And it will solve your problem.

astNode.text: But your java code is doing GET request to the server. So change your java code so that it does the POST request. And it will solve your problem.
